articles.title: MP Materials gets bullish Goldman call, Plug Power stock falls
articles.body: Yahoo Finance anchor Julie Hyman examines some of the top stories on Wall Street as part of Wednesdays Yahoo Finance Market Minute, including tech stock XLK action ahead of Nvidias NVDA earnings, Goldman Sachs initiating coverage on MP Materials MP, and Plug Power PLUG announcing plans to raise capital. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finances Market Minute.

articles.title: More Big Tech company debt would increase the macro risks associated with the AI build-out, Goldman Sachs warns
articles.body: Amazon, Google, Meta, Microsoft, and Oracle have taken on $121 billion in new debt, year-to-datequadruple the amount from the prior five years.

articles.title: The Dow Is Tracking Its Third Consecutive Loss Day
articles.body: The Dow is down 424 points or 0.9 percent in the early afternoon, under pressure from its heaviest hitting stocks. Shares of Goldman Sachs were down 1.6 percent. Microsoft, the third highest weighted stock, was down 0.7 percent.
articles.raw_text: The Dow Is Tracking Its Third Consecutive Loss Day. The Dow is down 424 points or 0.9 percent in the early afternoon, under pressure from its heaviest hitting stocks. Shares of Goldman Sachs were down 1.6 percent. Microsoft, the third highest weighted stock, was down 0.7 percent.

articles.title: Amazon Attracts About $80 Billion of Orders for US Bond Sale
articles.body: The company is seeking to raise about $12 billion through the debt offering, with the proceeds set to be used for everything from acquisitions and capital expenditures to share buybacks, according to people with knowledge of the matter. Goldman Sachs Group Inc., JPMorgan Chase Co. and Morgan Stanley are managing the bond sale, the people said, asking not to be identified discussing private details. JPMorgan Chase expects the fresh wave of spending to finance investments in artificial intelligence to drive issuance in the US high-grade-grade market to a record $1.81 trillion next year.

JPMorgan Chase expects the fresh wave of spending to finance investments in artificial intelligence to drive issuance in the US high-grade-grade market to a record $1.81 trillion next year.

articles.title: Clio Completes 1 billion dollars vLex Acquisition, Secures 500 million dollars At 5 billion dollars Valuation In Largest Legal Tech Deal
articles.body: Legal technology company Clio announced on Nov. 10 that it has closed what it calls one of the industrys most significant and largest transactions to date. The firm closed its $1 billion purchase of vLex while raising $500 million in a Series G round that valued the company at $5 billion. New Enterprise Associates led the Series G investment, joined by existing backers Technology Crossover Ventures, Goldman Sachs Asset Management, Sixth Street Growth, and JMI Equity. Do not Miss The AI Marketin
